head.title: Create charts in {{FileFormatUp}} files with {{ProgLang}}
head.description: The {{ProdFullName}} API makes it easy for developers to generate and insert charts or graphs into documents dynamically using real-time data.

header.title: Embed charts in {{FileFormatUp}} files with {{EnvNameShort}} API
header.description: {{ProdFullName}} provides a powerful way to populate {{FileFormatUp}} files with dynamic data and integrate charts effortlessly.
header.subtitle: {{ProdFullName}}

about.title: What is {{ProdFullName}}?
about.content: [{{ProdFullName}}]({{PlatformLink}}) is a tool designed to streamline the creation of documents and reports by integrating data from various sources. Easily generate charts, tables, lists, barcodes, and images dynamically. Advanced formatting options allow precise placement and customization of your content. It supports over 50 file formats, including PDFs, MS Office documents, and emails.

more_features.title: Add dynamic charts to your documents effortlessly
more_features.description: {{ProdFullName}} simplifies the creation of data-driven documents in widely-used formats. Use templates to insert charts, tables, barcodes, lists, hyperlinks, and images with advanced, dynamic data integration.

feature_1.title: Convert data into professional charts
feature_1.content: Turn data from JSON, XML, CSV, and other sources into visually appealing charts with just a few steps using our API.

feature_2.title: Create visually engaging content
feature_2.content: {{ProdShortName}} supports multiple chart types like bar graphs, pie charts, and line graphs. Combine these with tables, barcodes, images, and other elements to create professional reports.

feature_3.title: Precisely position and customize charts
feature_3.content: With LINQ syntax, you can dynamically generate and place charts exactly where needed. Easily customize styles, colors, and layout to match your requirements.

feature_4.title: Works with various file formats
feature_4.content: Produce documents in popular formats like MS Office, PDF, OpenOffice, and HTML. Embed charts seamlessly into any supported format with full compatibility.

formats.title: Create visually rich reports in multiple formats
formats.description: {{EnvName}} allows you to generate documents with integrated charts across 50+ supported formats, combining templates with your data seamlessly.

operations.title: Discover key capabilities
operations.description: Our platform helps you create compelling, data-driven documents tailored to your needs.

examples.comment_1: Include this tag in your template to generate a chart
examples.comment_2: Specify the file path for your template
examples.comment_3: Load data from your preferred source
examples.comment_4: Save the document with the chart embedded

steps.title: How to add a chart to a {{FileFormatUp}} document

content.title: [{{ProdShortName}}]({{PlatformLink}}) makes it simple to generate and embed charts into your {{FileFormatUp}} templates. Supports a variety of chart types, such as bar, pie, and line charts.
content.step_1: Design a {{FileFormatUp}} template with placeholders for the charts.
content.step_2: Retrieve your data from a compatible source.
content.step_3: Define chart options like type, labels, and color scheme.
content.step_4: Save the updated file with the chart embedded.

code_1.title: Create a chart programmatically
code_1.content: This example demonstrates how to dynamically create and embed a chart into a {{FileFormatUp}} document.
code_1.comment_1: Prepare a template with a placeholder for the chart
code_1.comment_2: Provide the path to the template file
code_1.comment_3: Retrieve the data from your source
code_1.comment_4: Build a data object with the necessary information
code_1.comment_5: Set up chart properties such as type and appearance
code_1.comment_7: Export the document with the chart included

texts_pdf.step_1: Design a template with designated spots for the chart (PDF templates are not supported).
texts_pdf.step_4: Export the document with the chart as a PDF file.
texts_pdf.comment_tmp: Currently, PDF templates are not supported.
